head.supplied: 17th Septr 1860. ¶ Sir, ¶ ¶ I am directed by the Governor to send you a copy of a letter from Sir Charles Phipps, conveying the thanks of H.R.H. the Prince Consort for the work forwarded by His Excel...

div.p: No. 56, unit 2, p. 129, VPRS 1092 Governor's letter books, VA 466 Governor, Public Record Office, Victoria.

C. B. Phipps, Treasurer to Prince Albert, submitted on the request of the Secretary of State for the Colonies a copy of M's Fragmenta phytographiae australiae, vol. 1, to the Prince Consort for his acceptance, and informed C. S. Fortescue, Under-Secretary of State for the Colonies, on 21 June 1860 that he had been 'commanded to request that you will cause to be conveyed to Dr Muller the expression of His Royal Highness' thanks to him for his Book'. The original of the request is at the National Archives, London, CO 309/53, f. 379; a copy of Phipps's letter was sent on 13 July 1860 to the Governor of Victoria, H. Barkly, who when he received it instructed Timins to write to M (No. 45, unit 13, VPRS 1087, Public Record Office, Victoria). The covering letter in the despatch to Barkly also informed him that copies of M's book had been sent, as requested, to the British Museum and the Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew. 17th Septr 1860.

I am directed by the Governor to send you a copy of a letter from Sir Charles Phipps, conveying the thanks of H.R.H. the Prince Consort for the work forwarded by His Excellency to His Royal Highness, at your request, in February last.
